content: You're absolutely right. Given how little we know about the deep sea, it is likely that there are many more new species, and important insights into the way life functions on Earth that await discovery in the Mariana Trench and other deep sea trenches. Some estimates suggest that as much as 90% of the ocean remains unexplored, so there is still much to discover and learn about our planet's hidden realms. Additionally, deep-sea exploration technology continues to evolve, providing scientists with new tools to explore and study the deep sea, which is expected to reveal more about the unique and fascinating creatures that inhabit its depths.
